description:
About Us

Strata Clean Energy is a leading developer, EPC, and service provider for utility-scale solar and storage systems in the United States. We control and self-perform all processes from our nationwide solar and storage developments, to construction, O&M, and Asset Management.

Our employees are empowered to drive our business in a collaborative, creative, and passion-driven environment that fosters long-term professional growth. There is a lot to learn at Strata, but we’re here to help you give your best and have a good time doing it.

At Strata, you’re part of something big. We’re leading the industry in sustainable energy careers. We are driving innovation to make a difference for our customers, our employees, and our planet. Join us in powering the future.

Overview

Strata Clean Energy intends to become one of the largest producers of green hydrogen derivatives (ammonia, methanol, methane, SAF). We intend to leverage our industry leading position in structuring 24/7 hourly matching renewable energy offtake contracts which draw power from our renewable energy portfolio which exceeds 18GWs. Join the team that is going to develop the solutions which promise to decarbonize the hardest segments of the modern industrial economy.

This teammate will work directly with our Head of P2X to maximize the revenue potential of our planned world scale projects. The individual will support the development and implementation of activities related to the development of a Green Ammonia market as part of the energy transition. The position is focused on hydrogen & Ammonia market development and strategy with the intention to further strengthen our ability to deliver innovative solutions for our clients. The ideal candidate will develop deep understanding of the technology and economics of Clean Hydrogen & Ammonia production.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities:

•Develop & execute sales strategies which consists of selling both the physical commodity and theenvironmental attributes (emissions credits) of P2X green hydrogen derivatives like ammonia.• Execute business plans that will assist in achieving sales objectives while maximizing the profitability of thebusiness.• Work with key customers to enhance their business and create synergy for both buyer and seller.• Be the source of local, domestic, and global market expertise regarding P2X derivative certificationrequirements.• Develop, Annual/Ongoing Sales Supply Agreements with strategic customers.• Actively participate, with the intent to serve on boards to advance P2X & clean ammonia initiatives.• Strategically analyze the market to identify growth/risks within the territory in both the long-term and shortterm.• Utilize product management experience work in broad geography to optimize volumes, focusing on reducingthe cost to serve and maximizing the net selling price.• Travel efficiently and intelligently to customer and industry meetings.

• Supervise external consultants as needed.

Qualifications

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree or higher in agriculture, business, marketing or related field• At least 4 years of experience in sales, product management, customer experience, or a related field• Highly developed customer service skills with a proven ability to grow and sustain strong customerrelationships• Demonstrated ability to meet and exceed sales goals and objectives with analytical and reporting capabilities• An awareness of industry standards related to handling, storage and use of fertilizer and specialty products• Performance-driven personality with results and solution orientation and the ability to sustain a professionalgrowth strategy while working independently• Proven ability to influence key stakeholders• Proven track record of margin optimization through continuous improvement initiatives• Excellent written, communication and presentation skills• Strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office components Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Power BI• Ability to work in and to foster a positive team environment• Excellent negotiation skills

No third party solicitations or resumes will be accepted for this or any other Strata Solar position.
